  • As Principal, Assist the Director in Growing The Team Of 14.

Assist the Director in growing and leading the Melbourne Contaminated Land consulting team at this specialist environmental consultancy with major strengths in Contaminated Sites, Occupational Hygiene and Geotechnical Engineering.


\xa0

Role Breakdown:

\xa0

  • Major projects across the Government, Defence & Private space
  • Reporting into the Directors, lead and manage the Melbourne contaminated land operation of this consultancy
  • Integral in the business growth, opportunity to work on the projects that interest you
  • Business Development through expanding services offered to existing clients, warm leads and utilising your own contacts.
  • Technical delivery from assessments / investigations through to due diligence and remediation
  • Current team of14 in Melbourne
  • Reporting into the Directors, you will also have the support of another Principal in Melbourne and you will have a strong senior management team to continue to develop from - bounce ideas off each other with regards to clients and project opportunities



\xa0

For the business, there are massive leverage opportunities with currently engaged large, medium & smaller scale clients where there are plenty of leads to pursue.
\xa0


They're looking for a sharp witted, smooth talking leader who can hold court with the likes of banks, lawyers and accountants where work is being derived.

Job description

Job Description

DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.technology .

Roles Across Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide

Responsibilities
  • Responsible for supply chain processes, such as inventory analysis, order fulfillment, import/export operations and shipping, for a country or regional business unit with minimum supervision applying discretion and judgement.
  • Compiles key metrics, produces reports, and analyzes data using IT systems for demand and supply matching activities.
  • Analysis of backlog management.
  • Gathers demand data from country and region for demand planning.
  • Reviews current business process for regional and global business unit planning teams.
  • Reviews performance metrics on a regular basis, identifying opportunities for improvement.

Education And Experience Required
  • First level university degree or equivalent experience.
  • Typically 0-2 years of experience in a supply chain function.

Knowledge And Skills
  • Good understanding of supply chain processes (plan, source, make deliver).
  • Demonstrated analytical skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.
  • Good interpersonal skills.
  • Basic Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
  • Basic understanding of project management methodology.
  • Developing business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
  • Introduction to the company's overall supply chain strategy.
  • Basic understanding of Material Requirements Planning (MRP) and ATP.
  • Basic understanding of import/export regulatory requirements and compliance.
  • Basic knowledge of inventory analysis.

851131207:
[

Commercial Reporting and Reporting Analyst

Company Name Life Without Barriers Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 79 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Life Without Barriers has been selected by the Victorian Government to operate a number of Supported Independent Living (SIL) and Short Term Accommodation and Assistance Programs (STAA) currently managed by the Victorian Department of Health and Human Services. To make the transfer of the services to Life Without Barriers as smooth as possible for the clients, staff and families involved, a number of positions are now available in this exciting project. These positions include a Commercial Performance and Reporting Analyst based in our Newcastle Head Office or our office in Inner East Melbourne. Due to the growth we are currently finalising our new office which will be in the Inner East of Melbourne. \xa0
\xa0 \xa0\xa0
Key Responsibilities
  • Establish and embed policies and process to ensure compliance with contractual reporting requirements
  • Monitor and review contractual reporting to provide high quality information to Executive, Senior managers and external stakeholders
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to coordinate and compile ad hoc, monthly, quarterly and annual performance reports
  • Deliver reliable and timely reports using enterprise platforms and data systems
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to analyse data systems and reporting current and future requirements
  • Monitor and review data governance arrangements for current and future requirements
  • Monitor, review and manage an integrated data/reporting timetable aligned to contractual calendars and business cycles
  • Manage data collection systems and resolve data problems to optimise statistical efficiency and data quality


Skills & Experience
  • Tertiary qualifications in business, management or similar
  • Significant experience in data collection and analysis in a large and complex service industry organisation
  • Demonstrated experience in seeking and understanding end user business requirements and translate into effective and efficient solutions
  • Demonstrated experience in managing competing priorities and to deliver high quality products within agreed timeframes
  • In depth knowledge of performance analysis, reporting and governance requirements, including identification of improvement opportunities
  • Demonstrated experience in influencing and working collaboratively with a range of stakeholders \xa0


Successful candidates will be required to clear probity checks including National Criminal History Record Check and Working with Children Check (where relevant to the role).
\xa0
Benefits
  • Newly created position within a growing and transforming organisation
  • Great tax benefits
  • Monthly rostered days off


How to Apply
Include your resume and covering letter in one document, click ‘Apply’ and follow the prompts. For any enquiries including persons with disability that require adjustments, contact recruitment@lwb.org.au
\xa0
Applications close at midnight 11 September 2018.

850256095:
[

Office Manager/HR Administrator (APAC)

Company Name Wrike Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 172 views

Job description

Wrike is a work management platform that is transforming the way people work and collaborate. We are focused on top-notch engineering, design, usability and dedicated customer care with a diversified international customer base of 16,000 and growing daily.


Our mission is to make teams insanely productive and we're guided by our core values to Grow, Execute and Collaborate. While we’re scaling quickly (over 600 Wrikers across the globe), we work hard to recruit the right teammates who share the same core values, know how to get things done, and add to an awesome culture.


Wrike is opening a new office in Melbourne, Australia and we are looking for an Office Manager who understands the importance of process and procedure, but appreciates a start-up environment. The perfect person will be passionate about company culture, and making Wrike an amazing place to work for all of our teams. You will be a key piece to our People Operations puzzle and you will support our international HR team with administrative projects keeping all the wheels turning behind the scenes at Wrike Australia.


Are you passionate about employee experience, and keen to learn more about HR and Recruitment? If your answers are yes - please read on!


About the Role: On a day to day basis you will partner directly with our International HR Manager & the People Operations team to optimize employee experience and help define what it means to be a Wriker! (Job responsibilities may vary)

(HR)

  • Update internal databases new employee information, contact details and employment forms
  • Prepare HR-related reports and analytics as needed
  • Address employee queries about benefits
  • Assist with employee orientation processes.

(Talent)

  • Help organize and streamline reporting within our Applicant Tracking System - Greenhouse
  • Assist in scheduling and confirming interviews with candidates across EMEA
  • Assist with internal job board, careers page and external posting strategy and management
  • Create, implement and manage social network calendar in order to support talent branding

(Workplace Operations)

  • Manage shipping, postage and stationary stock.
  • Assist with company culture events (low key & larger logistics)
  • Oversee and administer snack vendor and stock.
  • Manage company merchandise and supply.
  • Travel coordination - Airbnb, Uber, Visas & Invitation Letters (visas)
  • Low key events: birthdays, congratulatory gifts & celebrations, client onsites
  • Communications with building management & ensuring provision of access (fobs, car park remotes)


A strong candidate for this role looks like this:

  • Minimum of 2 years Office Manager or HR admin related experience
  • Strong at building relationships with stakeholders (at manager and employee level)
  • Are resourceful and self-directed; this role requires a highly competent and driven individual to get the ball rolling quickly
  • Proven ability to handle multiple tasks with little or no supervision
  • Ability to wear many hats on a day to day basis.
  • An extremely high sense of urgency and ability to work in fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
  • A natural born problem solver who enjoys the chaos of startup life.


In exchange for your efforts, we will offer the following;

  • Competitive compensation package.
  • Free catered lunch every day plus unlimited drinks and snacks
  • Company sponsored events
  • Flexible working conditions and working from home options

Customer Platform Product Manager

Company Name Sportsbet Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

Sportsbet is Australia’s leading online wagering company. We're part of a global company, a big player with a start-up soul. The pace of change is exhilarating, we’re constantly innovating to bring excitement to life for our customers and our people.

Perks
  • Free brekky, discounted Myki & gym memberships, loads of event & sports tickets
  • Tailored career development programs, as well as a commitment to developing Thought Leader and Specialist Talent programs
  • Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers
  • Flexible working environment cause’ we get that life doesn’t wait for outside 9-5
  • A generous employee bonus program
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave

The Team

In the Product team at Sportsbet we wear many hats, our roles are diverse. We are creators, initiators, challengers. We are responsible for product strategy, innovation and optimisation, not just build.

We’re lucky enough to work with the latest Tech & have great exposure to our senior leaders. Our mentality is a job is never done – we are ambitious and driven to succeed. We have the energy to create & challenge the status quo.

Most importantly, we are really bloody proud of our culture. We can be 100% ourselves. We’ve always got each other’s back. We take risks and innovate, constructively challenge, and we grow and learn together – professionally and as people.

The Role

As a member of our Customer & Commercial team, you will contribute to product strategy & setting vision for the Sportsbet portfolio along with capturing new product ideas and analysing their feasibility to ensure that we deliver maximum value.

In addition, you will be responsible for the product lifecycle management of in-market products to ensure ongoing value creation. Finally you will undertake market & competitor analysis and continuously assess product strengths and weaknesses to inform strategic direction.

Skills & Experience You Will Bring To The Table…
  • 3-5 years in a similar role in entertainment, digital and/ or consumer electronics industries
  • A good blend of technical & commercial know-how, and a passion for solving customer problems through great design
  • Commercial ability to produce business case and ROI projections for initiatives and to assess actual performance against projections
  • Ability to work closely with diverse stakeholders to drive business outcomes and optimise product in market
  • Familiarity with Lean Start Up/ Agile software development principles
  • Excellent presentation, communication and influencing skills

At Sportsbet, we take Responsible Gambling very seriously. Check out the tools & information we provide our customers to help manage their gambling on our dedicated site here .

Industry

  • Entertainment
  • Gambling & Casinos
  • Internet

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Product Management
  • Marketing

[

IT Business Partner

Company Name Cbus Super Fund Company Location Level 28 2 Lonsdale Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 247 views

Job description

We are currently undertaking a period of sustained growth at Cbus and as a result need an IT Business Partner to join the team.


You will be responsible for working closely with Cbus Business Units (BUs) and serve as a liaison between these BUs and our technology services delivery teams to ensure that business needs and requirements are being addressed across Plan, Build, and Run areas.

You will be responsible for IT Capital and Expense financial projections for new initiatives, demand management, planning, and oversight of IT deliverables for BUs as well as identifying technology solutions to meet evolving business needs.


You will have excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills and be able to translate business requirements through to our BA and Architect teams. You will be passionate about technology and be a champion of change keeping abreast of industry and technology initiatives. Your approach will be consultative, and you will strive to add value to your BUs.

Ideally you will have a minimum of 5-8 years of IT experience in mid-size financial services businesses including experience in technology lifecycle management. IT expertise in one or more disciplines, like systems development, infrastructure, change management, vendor management, commercial management, solution architecture would be advantageous.



Like to know more about working with Cbus? Listen to some of our videos with members of the Cbus team on our website. You will also be able to download the full position description from website - www.cbussuper.com.au/about-us/careers
\xa0
Please note that this position is based in Melbourne.

Applicants must have current rights to work in Australia

\xa0

Agencies, please note: All Cbus vacancies are managed by our internal Talent Acquisition Team. Should external assistance be required we will reach out to our preferred agency partners, Thank you.
